column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/af910fed59f9230c751ffb8441d045b6883d7e01 for binaries and test log.\n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/463a1cab43fda24f89f71fffc876756dc1bc155a for binaries and test log.\n
@sipa As this touches a part of your networking code, can you take a look here, too?\n

Agreed, bitmask arithmethic should be unsigned. Subsequent bit shifting can otherwise result in signed int overflows which are undefined in C(++). Though, scanning the code quickly, none of these happen at the moment. The largest shift we use with GetByte is 8. Still a useful precaution, though.\n
